710224f-c.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - 54th Street (West)
710224f-c.text:
Eighth Avenue, west side, south across W. 54th Street as photo-
graphed during the 8th Avenue subway construction period. Note the
6th Avenue ''E1'' line and station at 53rd Street. These were de-
molished i 1939.
Views 2 and 3 are limited to the respective S. W. and N. W.
corners of 54th Street.
View 1: February 5, 1928
View 2: May 21, 1939
View 3: October 22, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTINS

713734f-a.title: Manhattan: 54th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
713734f-a.text:

West 54th Street, south side, west from Eighth Ave.

710223f-c.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - 54th Street (West)
710223f-c.text:
Eighth Avenue. east side, south from W. 54th Street. The
6th Avenue ''El'' line appears on 53rd Street and is shortly to
be removed. Towering above same is the Hotel Capitol at 51st Street.
This was formerly the K. of C. Club-Hotel.
Views 2 and 3 are limited to th 54th - 53rd Street frontage.
Note the ''El'' station at the latter point. The Guild Theatre and
the Iceland Skating Rink are in the center of the block to the south.
View 1: May 21, 1939
View 2: August 24, 1936
View 3: August 7, 1930
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUUCTIONS

710227f-a.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - 54th Street (West)
710227f-a.text:
Eighth Ave., west side, north from and including West 54th to 59th
Streets. Note at the latter point, the Columbus Monument in Columbus
Circle. North of this point this thoroughfare becomes Central Park West.
May 5, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
